detaileddescription.para: Message code for starting recording
Message code for stopping recording
Message code for initiating a conversion and upload of the database. This message should always be sent along with the chosen protocol code as arg1. Example :
Message code for a sample action (used only internally)
The recording service using this handler
The listeners to the recording state
Indicate if the handler is currently recording
The number of ongoing sample task
The number of ongoing upload database task
The delay between samples
Indicate if the tasks should close the database when done
The SQLConnector used for all the database operations
Create a new RecordingHandler with the given sampleRate

parameterdescription.para: The initial value of the sample rate

detaileddescription.para: Indicate if a recording process is in progress
Add a recording listener
Remove a recording listener
Modify the sampling rate of the recording.

parameterdescription.para: The number of milliseconds between each sample

detaileddescription.para: Add file into the archive destined for the pending uploads

parameterdescription.para: The name of the file to add
The content of the file to add

detaileddescription.para: Action performed when a MESSAGE_START_RECORD is received. Might fail due to connector failing to open.
Action performed when a MESSAGE_STOP_RECORD is received.
Action performed when a MESSAGE_UPLOAD_DATABASE is received. Convert the whole database to a custom CSV file and try to upload this file with the chosen protocol

parameterdescription.para: The protocol used for the upload

detaileddescription.para: Action performed when a MESSAGE_SAMPLE is received
Check that no task will use the database in the future and close it if needed
Called when the recording process is finished and all the sampling tasks are done
Change and notify that the recording process state has changed
This Handler is used to manage AsyncTask related to the database by sending messages. The possible actions are starting or stopping a record and requesting an upload of the local database.
